title: Courier-esque
content:
Dear Keepers of All Font Knowledge,  
Can anyone ID this font? My closest guess is American Typewriter ... but I know that's incorrect.

Thank you!

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131015172214im_/http:/typophile.com/files/what_5935.png)
author: belonax

comments.content: Why do you think that’S incorrect? It’s [ITC American Typewriter Light Italic](http://web.archive.org/web/20131015172214/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/itc/american-typewriter/).

Thanks gang!  
Talk about lazy font searching on my part. I was looking on myfonts.com and there wasn't an italic listed in their ITC American Typewriter set. Silly, silly me.

A search for a specific font weight or style on MyFonts won't always get results, even if the font exists on their site.

Meanwhile:

[http://www.fontshop.com/search/?q=american+typewriter+light+italic](http://web.archive.org/web/20131015172214/http:/www.fontshop.com/search/?q=american+typewriter+light+italic "http://www.fontshop.com/search/?q=american+typewriter+light+italic")

[http://www.fonts.com/findfonts/mondosearchresults.htm?st=12&kid=american...](http://web.archive.org/web/20131015172214/http:/www.fonts.com/findfonts/mondosearchresults.htm?st=12&kid=american%20typewriter%20light%20italic "http://www.fonts.com/findfonts/mondosearchresults.htm?st=12&kid=american%20typewriter%20light%20italic")
Only American Typewriter from ITC directly or Elsner+Flake has Italics.
